class.name: GridContainer
class.brief_description: A container that arranges its child controls in a grid layout, with a given number of rows or columns.
class.description: [GridContainer] arranges its child controls in a grid layout. The number of columns is specified by the [member columns] property, whereas the number of rows depends on how many are needed for the child controls. The number of rows and columns is preserved for every size of the container. [b]Note:[/b] [GridContainer] only works with child nodes inheriting from [Control]. It won't rearrange child nodes inheriting from [Node2D].

members.member: The number of columns in the [GridContainer]. Can only be modified if the container is [member vertical]. When modified, [GridContainer] reorders its Control-derived children to accommodate the new layout.

The number of rows in the [GridContainer]. Can only be modified if the container is not [member vertical]. When modified, [GridContainer] reorders its Control-derived children to accommodate the new layout.

If [code]true[/code], the [GridContainer] will arrange its children vertically with a set number of [member columns]. If [code]false[/code], the [GridContainer] will arrange its children horizontally with a set number of [member rows]. Can't be changed when using [HGridContainer] and [VGridContainer].
